feedback_summary: Always use strict typing in Python files
root_cause: Inconsistent or absent type hints in Python code, leading to reduced code reliability, harder maintenance, and potential runtime errors

codified_improvements.title: Enforce strict typing with mypy in CI/CD
codified_improvements.description: Integrate mypy type checker into CI pipeline to fail builds on type errors, ensuring all Python files use strict typing (type hints on functions, variables, etc.)
codified_improvements.content: Add step: pip install mypy && mypy . --strict
acceptance_criteria: CI pipeline runs mypy on PRs and fails if type errors found
All existing code passes mypy or has migration plan

codified_improvements.title: Add mypy pre-commit hook
codified_improvements.description: Install mypy as a pre-commit hook to catch typing issues locally before commits
codified_improvements.content:
- repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/mirrors-mypy
  rev: v1.10.0
  hooks:
    - id: mypy
      args: [--strict]
acceptance_criteria: pre-commit run mypy passes on codebase
Hook installed and runs on git commit

codified_improvements.title: Add strict typing guideline
codified_improvements.description: Document requirement for type hints in all Python modules to promote best practices
codified_improvements.content:
## Type Hints
Always use strict typing:
- Add type hints to all functions, classes, and variables
- Use `from __future__ import annotations`
- Run `mypy --strict` locally before committing
acceptance_criteria: Guideline section added and visible in repo docs

prevents_future: Automation (mypy in CI/pre-commit) blocks non-compliant code from merging; guideline educates contributors for proactive compliance
original_feedback: Always use strict typing in Python files
